txt.en: 'I think it is too late for such concerns my friend.'
'The dying hunter sees no glory - only his end.'
'The fishermen are saying that this year's catch looks feeble.'
'It may well be that you are right, but we shall rue this day's decision none the less for it.'
'If we let go the hunting grounds to the Gauredain, our people may starve during the darkest months.'
'The Gauredain have overstepped their bounds this time!'
'I fear we are left with little choice.'
'Their hunters ambush our own relentlessly, driving us from our traditional hunting grounds.'
'It is time that we gathered the clans to strike back at them!'
'If some must die, then I say let it be with honour, by the spear!'
'And let the Gauredain die as well for their tresspass!'
'Then at least our families need not cower in fear, slowly starving during the Long Night.'
'So you are saying that our sons shall die either by hunger or by spear?'
'That is no choice at all...'
'There has always been strife between our people and the Gauredain.'
'Would you have it come to war as well?'
'Many men will die should we gather to arms and raise their ire further.'
'You are too naive, dear Pentti. You know too little of the world beyond these frozen shores.'
'Great events are unfolding, events that shall consume and destroy the clans if we do not act wisely.'
'The armies of Angmar are vast and even so they are not so great as the hosts of the far-off Dark Land, it is said.'
'We must choose our allies carefully, for the sake of our people.'
'You put too much trust in the words of the Men of the South.'
'Already the Rauta-väki have offered to help negotiate a peace between us and the Gauredain!'
'Trade with Angmar will allow us to survive the lean years, should it come to that.'
'There is unrest in the southern lands, dear Pentti. Surely you have heard the rumours?'
'The Rauta-väki claim to hold the Ironspan to prevent aggression against their lands from the South and West.'
'Their presence here does not concern our people.'
'It is not the Rauta-väki, but the Torni-väki that bring war to our doorstep!'
'I have spoken openly with the Emissaries of Angmar, while the Torni-väki skulk about, hooded and sly.'
'They are a motley lot at best, and hardly a force to be reckoned with.'
'Why the Kivi-väki were not here a day before they fell to squabbling over the old mines to the south.'
'At what cost? Shall we give over the hunting grounds of Länsi-mâ then?'
'Whilst the Vanha-väki have never offered any boon to the Lossoth. Likely they look down upon us in their arrogance.'
'How will we feed our people when the catch fails?'
'I do indeed hear rumours, Rikitsa, dark ones mostly.'
'I have heard it said that the Dourhands are puppets of Angmar.'
'I have even heard whispers that the Gauredain have fallen under their sway.'
'Trade eh? That's a fancy word for tribute if I've ever heard one.'
'How can you say this does not concern us!?'
'Angmar intrudes upon lands that have been ours for generations!'
'They risk bringing their foreign war here, when we already have troubles enough!'
'Rikitsa, my messengers claim to have seen Rauta-väki camps near the Ironspan.'
'If it is true that they have come at last into Forochel, then your hunters must have known of their arrival.'
'Why have you not spoken of this at the Council till now?'
'Have you known war Launo? I have...'
'It does not end so cleanly or honorably as you imagine.'
